p: Mapping the pairwise correlations in ILI and phase-angle trajectories revealed that influenza epidemics are highly synchronized across Norwegian municipalities, particularly with respect to epidemic timing ( Fig 2). Although some spatial structure is evident in the synchrony of epidemic amplitudes, with municipalities farther from Oslo tending to be less correlated ( Fig 2A), the corresponding phase correlations and phase differences suggest epidemic timing is more evenly distributed ( Fig 2B, S6 Fig). Most strikingly, we found strong phase correlations between Oslo and a number of distant northern municipalities.
